alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 04 at 4:17PM PDT until November 05 at 8:59PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Nisqually River Near National affecting Pierce and Lewis Counties. .Five inches of rain has already fallen in Mount Rainier National Park Friday with another two to two and a half inches forecast before the rain comes to an end Saturday morning. This amount of rain will push the Nisqually River near National above flood stage Friday evening. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nisqually River Near National. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 8,000.0 cfs, the Nisqually River will flood roads and pasture lands along the upper reaches of the river from Mt Rainier National Park downstream to Alder Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM PDT Friday the flow was 3,810.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of near 10,000 cfs late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood flow is 8,000.0 cfs. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9,830.0 cfs on 11/24/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 1215 AM PDT.
